name: BBL Speedway Stout
description: Draft

name: Monmouth Red
description: Sour Red aged in Apple Brandy Barrels

name: Currant Affair
description: A dark sour beer and a ton of red currants

name: Horse Tongue Thribble Currant
description: This beer is produced by taking Triple wort and fermenting it with our HTW culture - all done in wine barrels along with a very healthy dose of blackcurrant.  This beer is not fermented in a stainless tank and doesn't use brewer’s yeast at all - only the wild yeast and bacteria strains in our HTW culture.  Fermentation in the barrel takes up to 6 months.  Final ABV is estimated (we haven't tested it yet) to be 10.5%.  It's also bracingly sour with a pH of around 3.3.  Very cool purple/burgundy color.

name: Flanders Red aged in Woodford Reserve barrels aged for 2 years
Victory at Sea
description: Aged in Four Roses Bourbon Barrels

name: The Grizz
description: Belgian Brown Ale and this version was aged for 12 months in a 26 year old Charbay rum barrel. Charbay is the distiller who makes our Racer 5 and Big Bear into whiskey… & Pinot Noir Kolsch

name: Pinot Noir Kolsch
description: Our Kolsch that has been re-fermented with 10% pinot noir juice from the local Holdredge Wines here in Healdsburg

name: Cinammon Sunrise Stout
description: 12.7% ABV Double Cream Stout aged in Traverse City Whiskey barrels with cinnamon and vanilla beans.  Flavor Notes: Light whiskey, vanilla, woody, creamy, cinnamon spicy

name: Muerto Viviente
description: Tequila barrel aged Belgian Dark Strong ale and Cabernet barrel aged beer with Brett (name TBD)

name: TBD
description: Cabernet barrel aged beer with Brett (name TBD)

name: Vietnamese Coffee Dark Hollow
description: Collaboration with Mekong - The special beans used to age in the barrel with our strong stout were procured by Mekong's own An Bui.  With two pounds per barrel of the coffee, this iteration of Dark Hallow exudes a stong but rounded fresh and deep cofee flavor, matching the hearty oak char and vanilla flavors from the first-use Heaven Hill bourbon barrels.

name: Za'Tart
description: Low ABV, sour rustic blonde with Za’atar spices, Za’Tart is the beer that resulted from our collaboration with Cambridge Brewing Company.

name: Wild Horse Porter
description: fermented with wild brettanomyces yeast and is a collaboration between ourselves, Greg Engert of Bluejacket Brewery in DC and Peter Bouckaert of New Belgium.

name: Mash
description: An English Barleywine aged in Bourbon barrels, Mash is an intense yet balanced beer with notes of burnt caramel, toasted bread, ripe pear, dried figs, vanilla, toasted coconut and finishes with oak tannin.

name: Port Barrel Megalodon
description: Imperial Coffee Porter aged Woodford Reserve barrels previously used for making Port

name: Explorador Pale Ale
description: brewed with neomexicanus hops (it will highlight the Mintras and Amalia varieties of this native hops)

name: German Chocolate Cake Stout
description: Imperial milk stout with coconut and chocolate. Brewed for Bottlecraft (San Diego).

Pappy Van Winkle aged Derailler Barley Wine

Jong Kriek
description: based on our dark abbey ale, Local 2. We suffused it with whole cherries in barrels for five months, then re-fermented in the bottle with a blend of Champagne yeast and Brett. ABV 10.3%

name: Black Ops
description: strong stout concocted by the Brooklyn brewing team under cover of secrecy and hidden from everyone else at the brewery. The myth is that this supposed “Black Ops” was then aged for four months in bourbon barrels, bottled flat, and re-fermented with Champagne yeast.
